messages.author: satorux1
messages.text: This is a bit worrisome. I think LaunchProcess() should take std::vector<std::string> instead of std::string

messages.author: satorux1
messages.text: Place this member at the end.

messages.text:

Done.

messages.author: Seigo Nonaka
messages.text:
Unfortunately it accepts string16 only in Windows.

On 2013/03/01 05:35:28, satorux1 wrote:

> std::vector<std::string> instead of std::string

messages.author: satorux1
messages.text:
On 2013/03/01 07:19:16, Seigo Nonaka wrote:
> Unfortunately it accepts string16 only in Windows.
> 
> On 2013/03/01 05:35:28, satorux1 wrote:
> > This is a bit worrisome. I think LaunchProcess() should take
> > std::vector<std::string> instead of std::string
> 

I think you misunderstood my comment. Splitting command line by white space is a bad idea. This function should take a vector of strings instead.

Besides, this function seems to be only used from LaunchIBusDaemon(). I'd suggest to remove this function and use base::LaunchProcess() from LaunchIBusDaemon()

messages.author: Seigo Nonaka
messages.text:
Ah, sorry for my misunderstanding.
I updated to use LaunchProcess directly.

Thank you.

message: Change initialize function to static for testing.
